channel.title: Coding Connects
channel.description: A Blog about Coding in TypeScript and the life in Berlin

item.title: Typization of the Redux Store
item.description: I pick up the Redux Architecture which I developed in my last two posts and show how to obtain a typization of the Redux hooks. For this, I introduce and explain discriminated union types.

item.title: Movie `:` Debugging the Gender Gap
item.description: I recently found this interesting Movie exploring the Gender Gap in Coding. The movie tries to find explanations for the unequal distribution of people working in tech jobs/coding identifying them selfs as a male with respect to female or non-binary people.

item.title: Setting up a Redux Architecture with TypeScript
item.description: I show how to set up Redux together with TypeScript. Redux is a common library that is used with React for global state management. I explain here, how to configure the basic Redux configuration.

item.title: Improving the Redux Store Architecture
item.description: I continue with the App which I created in my last post. I discuss different techniques which lead to a cleaner React/Redux/TypeScript Architecture.

item.title: Testing a React Library with Jest and Enzyme
item.description: Continuing with the library developed in my last post, I show how to configure a testing environment, define test for the clock component and how to run and interpret those tests.

item.title: Creating a React Library with TypeScript
item.description: I show how to set up a react library which I publish to Github, so I can import it into a React project as a dependency. There is a powerful tool which allows to do a boilerplate approach to build a library: create-react-library.

item.title: Welcome to Ghost
item.description: Welcome, it's great to have you here. We know that first impressions are important, so we've populated your new site with some initial getting started posts that will help you get familiar with everything in no time.
